result.execSummary:
The defendant Darius L Belle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darius L Belle

records.addlTxt:
9:26 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Darius L Belle in court.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Darius L Belle. Court Reporter Sara Rogan.  

Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 
State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 
Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - Guilty  CFTS (21 days in RCJ) 
State consents to jury waiver. 
Agreement to use complaint for factual basis. 
BTC: GUILTY.
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 
Voting and Firearm Warning 

BTC: Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
CC+ DNA surcharge, apply bond.

8:28 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Darius L Belle in court.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Darius L Belle. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Defense indicates the defendant has a pending Kenosha Cty case that this stems from that is in trial posture, requests another status date. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on May 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Do not drive at all. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

9:12 AM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Darius L Belle appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez for Darius L Belle appeared in court. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defense motions to modify bond to a lower cash.
State objects with bond modification with argument.
BTC: Motion to modify bond is granted to $1000 cash, absolutely no driving. 
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Status conference scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
by DA to Defense to Obtain Copies of Certain Evidence.

records.addlTxt: Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Do not drive unless properly licensed. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:14 PM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Darius L Belle appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez for Darius L Belle appeared by video. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on March 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
